channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8768] Improve bulk load performance by moving key value construction from map phase to reduce phase.
item.description:
ImportTSV bulkloading approach uses MapReduce framework. Existing mapper and reducer classes used by ImportTSV are TsvImporterMapper.java and PutSortReducer.java. ImportTSV tool parses the tab(by default) seperated values from the input files and Mapper class generates the PUT objects for each row using the Key value pairs created from the parsed text. PutSortReducer then uses the partions based on the regions and sorts the Put objects for each region.

Overheads we can see in the above approach:
==========================================
1) keyvalue construction for each parsed value in the line adding extra data like rowkey,columnfamily,qualifier which will increase around 5x extra data to be shuffled in reduce phase.
We can calculate data size to shuffled as below


 Data to be shuffled = nl*nt*(rl+cfl+cql+vall+tsl+30)

If we move keyvalue construction to reduce phase we datasize to be shuffle will be which is very less compared to above.


 Data to be shuffled = nl*nt*vall

nl - Number of lines in the raw file
nt - Number of tabs or columns including row key.
rl - row length which will be different for each line.
cfl - column family length which will be different for each family
cql - qualifier length
tsl - timestamp length.
vall- each parsed value length.
30 bytes for kv size,number of families etc.

2) In mapper side we are creating put objects by adding all keyvalues constructed for each line and in reducer we will again collect keyvalues from put and sort them.
Instead we can directly create and sort keyvalues in reducer.

Solution:
========
We can improve bulk load performance by moving the key value construction from mapper to reducer so that Mapper just sends the raw text for each row to the Reducer. Reducer then parses the records for rows and create and sort the key value pairs before writing to HFiles.
Conclusion:
===========
The above suggestions will improve map phase performance by avoiding keyvalue construction and reduce phase performance by avoiding excess data to be shuffled.
item.summary: Improve bulk load performance by moving key value construction from map phase to reduce phase.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I am working on this. Its giving impressive results. I will give patch and performance results soon.

Just to add on to the above points
Depending on the data in bulk loading there is a possibility that number of mappers are few compared to number of Reducers (equal to number of regions). In this case, moving the work(construction of key values by parsing the text) from few mappers to more reducers will help in reducing this processing time as it will be distributed among more reducers.
Waiting for your results Rajesh
Moving out this improvement. If done in time, lets pull it back in (sounds like a nice improvement)

Patch for trunk. New custom mapper and reducer are introduced in this patch.

TsvImporterTextMapper : Parse rowkey and write the line bytes as it is to mapoutput. This is needed because existing mapper will help in non-bulkloading case where we will write puts directly to table.

TextSortReducer: Parse values,prepare kvs from text line and write to hfile after sorting kvs of each row.

Please review the patch.

Thanks Jyothi Mandava for internal review and performance report.
Here is the performance report.Since we have internally developed this in 0.94.8 first,we have tested this patch with 0.94.8 and Hadoop-2.0.5. Hope similar improvement will be there in trunk as well.
Nice work. The number of bytes that is reduced is very huge. Impresssive

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12594382/HBase_Bulkload_Performance_Improvement.pdf
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6479//console

This message is automatically generated.

The improvement looks promising. It will give more and more % improvement when the columns in line are increasing. Good work..

parseRowKey returns start pos and end pos of the RK in the line. Better to return a Pair<Integer, Integer>? Within the method use int vars like startPos and endPos so that readability cab be better?
Patch Addressing Anoop's comments.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12594638/HBASE-8768_v3.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.

For TextSortReducer, please add stability and audience annotation.


+ * @see HFIleOutputFormat

Typo above.


+    while (iter.hasNext()) {

+      TreeSet<KeyValue> map = new TreeSet<KeyValue>(KeyValue.COMPARATOR);

Why is a new map created in each iteration of the loop ?
Since the map is backed by TreeSet, maybe just call it set ?


+            return;

+          } else {

+            throw new IOException(badLine);

The else keyword can be omitted.


+        if (index > 0 && index % 100 == 0)

+          context.setStatus("Wrote " + index);

Please complete the sentence above.


+public class TsvImporterTextMapper

Add stability and audience annotation.


+    } catch (InterruptedException e) {

+      e.printStackTrace();

+    }

Restore interrupt state.


+  public void testBulkOutputwithTsvImporterTextMapper() throws Exception {

Please upper case the 'w' in 'with'

Patch addressing Ted's comments.

Ted Yu
Thanks for review.

Why is a new map created in each iteration of the loop

The next set will be created only after reaching configured thresold. Its not for each iteration. Handled all other comments in the current patch.
